image.altText: Two women at a press conference.

props.synopsis: Speaking on behalf of some of the victim-survivors, their families and whistleblowers who engaged with Tasmania's child sexual abuse commission of inquiry, Katrina Munting called on the state government to offer more support for victim-survivors and to respond more quickly to the commission's recommendations.Â

title.children: 'Chewed up and then spat out': Fallout from Tasmania's child sexual abuse inquiry 'immense', victim-survivor says

image.altText: Three women smile for a camera while wearing designer clothing.

props.synopsis: There is a real-time example playing out on the world stage of how salaries are impacted by structures that were built for men decades before anyone thought to include women.

title.children: Caitlin Clark is this year's number one draft pick in the WNBA. Her salary has sparked outrage

image.altText: The white facade of Immaculate Conception Cathedral in Samoa, under a grey sky.

props.synopsis: In Samoa, churches spend millions building cathedrals to connect communities to God. But as debts and poverty skyrocket, many are questioning the price tag.

title.children: Faith with a price tag: How much should people pay to connect to God?

image.altText: New King Island ferry John Duigan

props.synopsis: It is normally lush and green, but King Island is drought-stricken and its farmers are calling for help to ship their cattle and sheep north to the mainland.

title.children: King Island desperate to ship cattle to Victoria as drought takes hold, Premier looks into route

image.altText: Katy Gallagher, sitting with Jim Chalmers, holds the women's economic budget statement

props.synopsis: Treasurer Jim Chalmers's third budget will be his first not wholly dominated by inflation, which will share the stage with trouble in China and sluggish economic growth. What story will the government seek to tell?

title.children: For the first time this term, inflation may not dominate the budget. What will?

image.altText: An illustration showing a pink silhouette against a backdrop of Japanese imagery.

props.synopsis: A landmark racial discrimination case comes as the country grapples with questions about race, immigration and what it means to be Japanese.

title.children: 'Big elephant in the room': A lawsuit in Japan has put the spotlight on race

image.altText: Donald Trump sits in a suit, blue tie and white shirt looking sternly at the camera behind a desk

props.synopsis: Lawyers faced major challenges in trying to assemble a jury for one of the most high-profile cases in US history.

title.children: Twelve jurors selected for Donald Trump's 'hush money' New York trial after several dismissals

image.altText: Wind turbines in the background, with golden paddock and sheep looking at the camera in the foreground

props.synopsis: The federal government plans to spend tens of billions of dollars building new green energy projects. An analyst is warning against "zombie projects" that go nowhere.Â

title.children: Mammoth federal green scheme risks 'zombie projects' that never get built, analyst warns

image.altText: An unidentified person looks at a screen with property for rent on it.

props.synopsis: An error made by the owner meant Sarah became the sole tenant on the lease for a bargain price, but months later, people started showing up at her door.

title.children: When Sarah secured a family home near Brisbane for $115 a week, she had no idea of the nightmare that would follow

image.altText: A military base fenced with barbed wire

props.synopsis: Israel's defence force denies serious allegations of abuse and torture from several Gazan men who say they were detained without charge. WARNING: Readers might find some of the details in this story distressing.

title.children: It's been called Israel's 'Guantanamo'. A doctor who worked in the secretive facility is now speaking out

image.altText: emergency services crowded on the street outside the shopping centre

props.synopsis: A leading neuropsychiatrist says there was a potential "systemic failure" by Queensland authorities when it came to treating and communicating about Joel Cauchi.

title.children: Specialist says there may have been 'systemic failures' between authorities over the treatment of Joel Cauchi

image.altText: Through the doors of a shopping centre people are seen walking around, there is a sign that says 'together we remember'

props.synopsis: The retail workers union is pleading with the public not to ask retail workers to re-live the Bondi Junction attacks as retail stores re-open today.Â

title.children: Union calls on public not to 're-traumatise' Bondi workers by asking them about attack as shops reopen

image.altText: A black and white photo of Swift holding up The Tortured Poets Department, and peering through the transparent vinyl

props.synopsis: The Tortured Poets Department could very well break streaming records, but it also poses a headache for Taylor Swift's Eras Tour. How do you include another album into a show that's already over three hours long?

title.children: Taylor Swift's The Tortured Poets Department is nearly here, but it could be a logistical nightmare for the Eras Tour

image.altText: People walking through a lit up forest

props.synopsis: In a beloved Melbourne wildlife reserve, Warner Brothers was given the green light to conjure up fantastical scenes straight from Harry Potter. But behind the scenes, the local council was warned this would risk banishing their own, real-world creatures.

title.children: Even before public controversy forced a Harry Potter event backflip, the local council was given a warning

image.altText: Two children smiling run down the street in Bhutan.

props.synopsis: Bhutan is known for being one of the happiest countries in the world, but mental health professionals say its people are suffering in silence due to cultural traditions and societal expectations of positivity.

title.children: Bhutan is known for being a happy country, but mental health is a hidden problem

image.altText: Kids shoes on skateboard

props.synopsis: Seven months ago the Queensland government was warned that without an additional youth justice lawyer in Cairns, the number of youth detainees in the Cairns watch house would worsen. Advocates say thatâs exactly what happened.Â

title.children: 'Inexplicable' that youth justice lawyer role in Cairns not approved, advocates say

image.altText: The PM speaking next to the AFP commissioner Reece Kershaw and ASIO boss Mike Burgess

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese is fast discovering why his prime ministerial predecessor Scott Morrison took the unorthodox approach of being secretly sworn into a raft of ministries, having been reminded that a PM's power only extends so far when it comes to immigration visas.Â

title.children: In vouching for Bollard Man, Albanese set himself an uncomfortable precedent

image.altText: a bishop at an assyrian orthodox church during a service before a person approaches and allegedley stabs him

props.synopsis: A 16-year-old boy who allegedly stabbedÂ Sydney bishop Mar Mari Emmanuel at Christ The Good Shepherd Church in Wakeley has been charged with committing a terrorist act.

title.children: Police charge teenage boy who allegedly stabbed bishop with terrorism offence

image.altText: An AI-generated image of two people in a cafe.

props.synopsis: Artificial intelligence is being used to generate child abuse material, and police are increasingly worried about its spread. But AI may also be able to help investigators.

title.children: This image is AI-generated. It's innocent, but there are others police are very worried about

image.altText: Patrick Halley wears medals and holds his Gunner's Wings medal

props.synopsis: A Vietnam War veteran who was involved in carrying out hazardous operations against well-armed Viet Cong guerilla forces and soldiers has finally received his award for service, more than 50 years after returning home.

title.children: Private Halley was reading a book on war memorabilia when he realised he was 50 years overdue for a service award

image.altText: a house for sale in the brisbane suburb of stafford with the sale sign in the front yard

props.synopsis: A Gold Coast building and pest inspector whoÂ receives regular call-outs to newly-purchased properties with structural or termite issues says he believes homebuyers are being pressured to sign contracts without doing due diligence.

title.children: Rushed buyers at risk of purchasing homes with defects during property boom, inspector warns

image.altText: Woolworths shopfront at Montague Markets in West End, Brisbane.

props.synopsis: Â Woolworths admitted in court that it short-changed at least 1,235 former Victorian employees by not properly paying their long service leave entitlements.

title.children: Woolworths admits to underpaying staff  $1.24m

image.altText: James Warburton

props.synopsis: Seven West Media chief executive and managing director JamesÂ Warburton steps down with immediate effect.Â

title.children: James Warburton steps down as Seven West Media CEO with immediate effect

image.altText: A window on a tall building with black streaks of smoke damage smeared across it.

props.synopsis: Fire authorities have warned of the growing risk of lithium batteries after 50 residents were evacuated from a building due to anÂ exploding mobile phone power bank.

title.children: Fire authorities warn of lithium-ion battery risks after two students narrowly escape Melbourne fire

image.altText: Anthony Albanese at a press conference.

props.synopsis: Australia's multiculturalism is enduring unprecedented strains, with all the difficulties that brings for political and community leaders.

title.children: Ethnic tensions will complicate the Albanese governmentâs multicultural policy reform

image.altText: A concept image of Toondah Harbour

props.synopsis: Earlier this month Tanya Plibersek released an interim decision that found removing 58.7 hectares from the internationally protected wetland was an "unacceptable impact".

title.children: 'It will not go ahead': Company withdraws bid to develop protected wetlands after environment minister's interim refusal

image.altText: A man in a suit holds his hand over his eyes from the sun as he speaks into a microphone

props.synopsis: Experts say the allegations against him and support for his party are just part of a "concerning" shift towards the far-right and extremism across Europe.Â

title.children: A German far-right leader allegedly used a Nazi slogan twice â his 'extremist' party is one of the country's highest-polling

image.altText: AFL coach Ross Lyon walking off the ground with two players after a match

props.synopsis: St Kilda coach Ross Lyon has said the recent demands on his football side can explain their 60-point defeat to the Western Bulldogs on Thursday night.Â

title.children: 'I'd like to think that's not us': Ross Lyon defends St Kilda after 60-point drubbing to Western Bulldogs

image.altText: Flowers in colour and the background in black and white.

props.synopsis: Australia's spy boss was asked why Monday night's church stabbing was ruled a terrorist attack, while Saturday's stabbing rampage â where one man and five women were killed in Bondi Junction â was not. He said it wasn't. But should it have been?Â

title.children: Could attacks on predominantly women ever be considered terrorism?

image.altText: A plant with a long stem and purple flowers on the end

props.synopsis: Some plants seem full of promise and intrigue at the nursery, but are full of surprises later on â when they're threatening to overthrow the boundary fence. What are the common horticultural culprits?

title.children: Plants you shouldn't plant, according to the experts

image.altText: A group of police officers stand in a paddock.

props.synopsis: The ram was shot and killed by police when they arrived at the property.

title.children: Elderly couple believed to have been killed by ram in NZ

image.altText: A wide road covered in water with cars and trucks stuck in the middle.

props.synopsis: Speculation swirled on social media that the weather technology was to blame for the largest ever rainfall Dubai has seen. But experts sayÂ the record rains were on a totally different scale to what seeding would produce.

title.children: Speculation 'cloud seeding' caused Dubai record rainfall and floods shot down by experts

image.altText: Indonesia volcano

props.synopsis: Indonesian authorities issue a tsunami alert after eruptions at Ruang mountain send ash thousands of feet high, with hundreds evacuated from the area.Â

title.children: Indonesia issues tsunami alert as volcano erupts
